member.name: T:SharpKit.Rx.Observable
member.summary: Provides a set of static methods for query operations over observable sequences.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Rx.Observable.interval(System.Int64,SharpKit.Rx.IScheduler)
member.summary: Returns an observable sequence that produces a value after each period.
member.param: Period for producing the values in the resulting sequence (specified as an integer denoting milliseconds).
Scheduler to run the timer on. If not specified, the timeout scheduler is used.
member.returns: An observable sequence that produces a value after each period.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Rx.Observable.timer(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsDate,System.Int64,SharpKit.Rx.IScheduler)
member.summary: Returns an observable sequence that produces a value after dueTime has elapsed and then after each period.
member.param: Absolute (specified as a Date object) at which to produce the first value.
Period to produce subsequent values (specified as an integer denoting milliseconds). If not specified, the resulting timer is not recurring.
Scheduler to run the timer on. If not specified, the timeout scheduler is used.
member.returns: An observable sequence that produces a value after due time has elapsed and then each period.

member.summary: Returns an observable sequence that produces a value after dueTime has elapsed and then after each period.

member.returns: An observable sequence that produces a value after due time has elapsed and then each period.

Period to produce subsequent values (specified as an integer denoting milliseconds). If not specified, the resulting timer is not recurring.

member.returns: An observable sequence that produces a value after due time has elapsed and then each period.

Relative time (specified as an integer denoting milliseconds) by which to shift the observable sequence.
Scheduler to run the delay timers on. If not specified, the timeout scheduler is used.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Rx.Observable.throttle``1(SharpKit.Rx.IObservable{``0},System.Int64,SharpKit.Rx.IScheduler)

Duration of the throttle period for each value (specified as an integer denoting milliseconds).

member.name: M:SharpKit.Rx.Observable.windowWithTime``1(SharpKit.Rx.IObservable{``0},System.Int64,System.Int64,SharpKit.Rx.IScheduler)
member.summary:
Projects each element of an observable sequence into zero or more windows which are produced based on timing information.
res = xs.windowWithTime(1000, 500 /*, scheduler */); // segments of 1 second with time shift 0.5 seconds
member.param: The source sequence.
Length of each window (specified as an integer denoting milliseconds).

Interval between creation of consecutive windows (specified as an integer denoting milliseconds), or an optional scheduler parameter. If not specified, the time shift corresponds to the timeSpan parameter, resulting in non-overlapping adjacent windows.
Scheduler to run windowing timers on. If not specified, the timeout scheduler is used.
member.returns: An observable sequence of windows.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Rx.Observable.windowWithTime``1(SharpKit.Rx.IObservable{``0},System.Int64,SharpKit.Rx.IScheduler)
member.summary:
Projects each element of an observable sequence into zero or more windows which are produced based on timing information.
res = xs.windowWithTime(1000, scheduler); // non-overlapping segments of 1 second
member.param: The source sequence.
Length of each window (specified as an integer denoting milliseconds).
[Optional] Scheduler to run windowing timers on.
member.returns: An observable sequence of windows.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Rx.Observable.windowWithTimeOrCount``1(SharpKit.Rx.IObservable{``0},System.Int64,System.Int32,SharpKit.Rx.IScheduler)
member.summary: Projects each element of an observable sequence into a window that is completed when either it's full or a given amount of time has elapsed.
member.param: The source sequence.
Maximum time length (specified as an integer denoting milliseconds) of a window.
Maximum element count of a window.
Scheduler to run windowing timers on. If not specified, the timeout scheduler is used.
member.returns: An observable sequence of windows.

Schedules the specified action recursively, supplying it the given initial state object.
E.g. var cancel = Rx.Scheduler.CurrentThread.schedule(0, function (i, self) { alert('Hello ' + i + '!'); self(i + 1); });

member.param: Initial state to pass to the action.
Relative time (specified in milliseconds) at which to schedule the given action the first time.

Action to be scheduled. The first parameter passed to the action corresponds to the given state object. The second parameter passed to the action is a function that can be invoked to make a recursive call.
